==Events==
* [[473]] &ndash; Emperor [[Leo I the Thracian|Leo I]] acclaims his grandson [[Leo II (emperor)|Leo II]] as ''[[Caesar (title)|Caesar]]'' of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1147]] &ndash; The [[Portugal|Portuguese]], under [[Afonso I]], and Crusaders from England and [[Flanders]] conquer [[Lisbon]] after a [[Siege of Lisbon|four-month siege]].
*  1147   &ndash; [[Seljuk Turks]] completely annihilate German crusaders under [[Conrad III of Germany|Conrad III]] at the [[Battle of Dorylaeum (1147)|Battle of Dorylaeum]].
*[[1154]] &ndash; [[Henry II of England|Henry II]] becomes [[King of England]].
*[[1415]] &ndash; The army of [[Henry V of England]] defeats the [[France|French]] at the [[Battle of Agincourt]].
*[[1616]] &ndash; [[Netherlands|Dutch]] sea-captain [[Dirk Hartog]] makes second recorded landfall by a European on [[Australia]]n soil, at the later-named [[Dirk Hartog Island]] off the [[Western Australia|West Australian]] coast.
*[[1747]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] fleet under Admiral Sir [[Edward Hawke]] defeats the French at the [[second battle of Cape Finisterre (1747)|second battle of Cape Finisterre]].
*[[1760]] &ndash; [[George III of the United Kingdom|George III]] becomes [[British monarch|King of Great Britain]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: The American frigate, {{USS|United States|1797|6}}, commanded by [[Stephen Decatur]], [[USS United States vs HMS Macedonian|captures]] the British frigate {{HMS|Macedonian}}.
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: The [[First Siege of Missolonghi]] begins.
*[[1828]] &ndash; [[St Katharine Docks]] open in [[London]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Balaklava]] during the [[Crimean War]] ([[Charge of the Light Brigade]]).
*[[1861]] &ndash; The [[Toronto Stock Exchange]] is created.
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom]] annexes the [[Transvaal Colony|Transvaal]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; Traditionally understood date of the [[October Revolution]], involving the capture of the [[Winter Palace]], [[Petrograd]], [[Russia]]. The date refers to the Julian Calendar date, and corresponds with November 7 in the Gregorian calendar.
*[[1920]] &ndash; After 74 days on [[Hunger Strike]] in Brixton Prison, England, the [[Sinn Féin]] [[Lord Mayor of Cork]], [[Terence MacSwiney]] dies.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Zinoviev Letter]], which Zinoviev himself denied writing, is published in the ''[[Daily Mail]]''.  The Labour party would later blame this letter for the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservatives]]' landslide election win.
*[[1938]] &ndash; The [[Archbishop of Dubuque]], [[Francis Beckman|Francis J. L. Beckman]], denounces [[Swing (genre)|swing]] music as "a degenerated musical system… turned loose to gnaw away at the moral fiber of young people", warning that it leads down a "primrose path to [[hell]]". His warning is widely ignored.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Benjamin O. Davis, Sr.]] is named the first [[African American]] general in the [[United States Army]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Heinrich Himmler]] orders a crackdown on the [[Edelweiss Pirates]], a loosely organized [[youth culture]] in [[Nazi Germany]] that had assisted army deserters and others to hide from the [[Third Reich]].
*  1944   &ndash; The [[USS Tang (SS-306)|USS ''Tang'']] under [[Richard O'Kane]] (the top American submarine captain of [[World War II]]) is sunk by the ship's own malfunctioning [[torpedo]].
*  1944   &ndash; The [[Hungary|Hungarian]] city of [[Nagykároly]] is occupied by [[Soviet]] and [[Romania]]n forces.
*  1944   &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] — the largest [[naval battle]] in history, takes place in and around the [[Philippines]] between the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] and the U.S. Third and U.S. Seventh Fleets. Afterward is the first Kamikaze attack of the war.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Republic of China]] takes over administration of [[Taiwan]] following [[Japan]]'s surrender to [[Allies of World War II|the Allies]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Cuban missile crisis]]: [[Adlai Stevenson II|Adlai Stevenson]] shows photos at a meeting of the [[United Nations]] [[United Nations Security Council|Security Council]] proving that [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] missiles are installed in [[Cuba]].
*  1962   &ndash; [[Uganda]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*  1962   &ndash; [[Nelson Mandela]] is sentenced to five years in prison.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[United Nations]] seats the [[People's Republic of China]] and expels the [[Republic of China]] (see [[political status of Taiwan]] and [[China and the United Nations]])
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Digital Equipment Corporation]] releases [[OpenVMS]] V1.0.
*[[1980]] &ndash; Proceedings on the [[Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction]] conclude at [[The Hague]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Invasion of Grenada|Operation Urgent Fury]]:  The [[United States]] and its [[Caribbean]] allies invade [[Grenada]], six days after [[Prime Minister of Grenada|Prime Minister]] [[Maurice Bishop]] and several of his supporters are [[execution (legal)|executed]] in a [[coup d'état]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[History of Slovenia]]: Three months after the end of the [[Ten-Day War]], the last soldier of the [[Yugoslav People's Army]] leaves the territory of the [[Republic of Slovenia]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Fox River Grove level crossing accident|A commuter train slams into a school bus]] in [[Fox River Grove, Illinois]], killing seven students.
*[[1997]] &ndash; After a brief [[civil war]] which has driven President [[Pascal Lissouba]] out of [[Brazzaville]], [[Denis Sassou-Nguesso]] proclaims himself the President of the [[Republic of the Congo]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Cuba]]an President [[Fidel Castro]] announces that transactions using the [[American Dollar]] will be banned.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[25 October 2009 Baghdad bombings]] kills 155 and wounds at least 721.
